content.description: A referee moves along a straight path on the side of an athletic field. The velocity of the referee is given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, 4 times, open parenthesis, t minus 6, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 t plus 5, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mo>⁡</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>, where <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in minutes and <math alttext="v of t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is measured in meters per minute.
content.question: What is the total distance traveled by the referee, in meters, from time <math alttext="t equals 2" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </math> to time <math alttext="t equals 6" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
